triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: LLMs are the foundational technology enabling multi-agent systems discussed in this survey.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multi-agent systems are the primary architectural framework surveyed in this paper.

triples.name: Automated reasoning
triples.relevance: Reasoning is a key capability of LLMs that enables multi-agent decision-making.

triples.name: Automated planning and scheduling
triples.relevance: Planning is a core capability of LLM-based agents for coordinating multi-agent actions.

triples.name: Artificial general intelligence
triples.relevance: AGI is the ultimate goal mentioned for LLM-based multi-agent systems in this survey.

triples.name: Machine perception
triples.relevance: Perception is a key workflow component enabling agents to sense and understand their environment.

triples.name: Intelligent agent
triples.relevance: Intelligent agents are the core entities in LLM-based multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Problem solving
triples.relevance: Problem-solving is identified as a principal application area for LLM-based multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Computer simulation
triples.relevance: World simulation is identified as a principal application area for LLM-based multi-agent systems.
